alert.note: Alert for Harrison; Pottawattamie (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 5:56AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Pottawattamie, southwestern Harrison and central Washington Counties through 630 AM CDT... At 556 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles northwest of Kennard, or 7 miles west of Blair, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree branches and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Kennard around 600 AM CDT. Blair around 610 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Modale and Missouri Valley. This includes Interstate 29 between mile markers 71 and 86. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 AM CDT for southwestern Iowa...and east central Nebraska.
